item.title: Stina add a quote by Ann Rinaldi
item.description: "Love is like light and there are two kinds, the bursting fireworks of the moment and the solid, fixed stars that sometimes become obscured in the heavens, but are always there, year after year, for a lifetime." -- Ann Rinaldi

item.title: Stina add a quote by Ann Rinaldi
item.description: "A person doesn't ask permission to fall in love; not even of themselves." -- Ann Rinaldi

item.title: Stina add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Well, we all make mistakes, dear, so just put it behind you. We should regret our mistakes and learn from them, but never carry them forward into the future with us." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Stina add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "Perhaps, after all, romance did not come into one’s life with pomp and blare, like a gay knight riding down; perhaps it crept to one’s side like an old friend through quiet ways; perhaps it revealed itself in seeming prose, until some sudden shaft of illumination flung athwart its pages betrayed the rhythm and the music, perhaps . . . perhaps . . . love unfolded naturally out of a beautiful friendship, as a golden-hearted rose slipping from its green sheath." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Stina add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Isn't it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Stina add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Stina add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There are as many forms of love as there are moments in time." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Stina add a quote by M. M. Kaye
item.description: "They rode out together from the shadows of the trees, leaving the Bala Hissar and the glowing torch of the burning Residency behind them, and spurred away across the flat lands towards the mountains... And it may even be that they found their Kingdom." -- M. M. Kaye

item.title: Stina add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You know, you could live a thousand lifetimes and not deserve him." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Stina add a quote by Salvador Plascencia
item.description: "I don’t know what they are called, the spaces between seconds– but I think of you always in those intervals." -- Salvador Plascencia

item.title: Stina add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Sometimes when I look at you, I feel I'm gazing at a distant star. It's dazzling, but the light is from tens of thousands of years ago. Maybe the star doesn't even exist any more. Yet sometimes that light seems more real to me than anything." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Stina add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "The sea always filled her with longing, though for what she was never sure." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Stina add a quote by T.H. White
item.description: "She hardly ever thought of him. He had worn a place for himself in some corner of her heart, as a sea shell, always boring against the rock, might do. The making of the place had been her pain. But now the shell was safely in the rock. It was lodged, and ground no longer." -- T.H. White

item.title: Stina add a quote by Iain Pears
item.description: "For the first time, she did want more. She did not know what she wanted, knew that it was dangerous and that she should rest content with what she had, but she knew an emptiness deep inside her, which began to ache." -- Iain Pears

item.title: Stina add a quote by Percy Bysshe Shelley
Stina add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description:
"Sir,"she said,"you are no gentleman!"
An apt observation,"he answered airily."And, you, Miss, are no lady." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Stina add a quote by Jennifer Lynn Barnes
item.description:
"Katniss isn't the kind of hero we're used to seeing in fiction. She reacts more than she acts, she doesn't want to be a leader, and by the end of <i>Mockingjay</i>, she hasn't come into her own or risen like a phoenix from the ashes for some triumphant moment that gives us a sense of satisfaction with how far our protagonist has come.
She's not a Buffy. She's not a Bella. She limps across the finish line when we're used to seeing heroes racing; she eases into a quiet, steady love instead of falling fast and hard." -- Jennifer Lynn Barnes
